result.execSummary:
The defendant James Larry May was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay applicable costs, surcharges and assessments by 4-9-15; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.

Huber privileges for work and child care conditional upon absolute sobriety and no driving without a valid license. No electronic monitoring for at least the first 90 days. Order in date 4/11. 5pm; failure to report will vacate Huber privilege. Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay by 4/9/15.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession; Voting.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Denying Request to Reinstate Release Privileges.  kmw
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Glenn H. Yamahiro, Branch 34, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request to reinstate release privileges.
Order For Cancellation of Huber/Work Release/Electronic Surveillance Privileges Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 303.08(2), 973.09(4), and 973.03(4) received, signed, and filed with court.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Order for Canellation of Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Yamahiro, Br 34 for review. os

Defendant James Larry May in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Count 1:  Dismissed and read-in
Count 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
**********
Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 2 DAYS time served and Huber privileges for work and child care conditional upon absolute sobriety and no driving without a valid license.  No electronic monitoring for at least the first 90 days.  Order in date 4/11, 5pm; failure to report will vacate Huber privilege.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges and assessments by 4/9/15; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.
The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay by 4/9/15; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting
Filed,

Defendant James Larry May in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Randy Sitzberger for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 2/20/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant James Larry May in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant James Larry May in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge YAMAHIRO, Branch 34.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
